units.title: Cloning sgRNA pairs and constructing lentiviral library
units.text: We individually cloned sgRNA pairs and pooled them equally to construct a lentiviral plasmid library (Extended Data Fig. 3a,b).
units.rationale: Creates the pooled sgRNA library needed for CRISPR perturbations.

units.title: Generating barcoded library via PCR
units.text: To generate a barcoded library, the following primers were used to individually amplify each dual sgRNA cassette from the lentiviral construct used in the reporter assay while introducing a 15 base pair barcode.
units.rationale: Adds unique barcodes to each sgRNA cassette for clonal tracking.

units.title: Forming embryoid bodies for organoid generation
units.text: Cerebral organoids were generated using a previously published protocol with modifications23. In brief, cells were cultured to 70–80% confluence, and 16,000 live cells in 150 μl Essential8 medium supplemented with Revitacell (ThermoFisher, catalogue no. A2644501) were added to each well of a U-bottom ultralow attachment 96-well plate (Corning, catalogue no. CLS3473) to form embryoid bodies.
units.rationale: Establishes the initial 3‑D aggregates that will develop into organoids.

units.title: Inducing eCas9 with 4‑hydroxytamoxifen
units.text: For eCas9 induction, 4‑hydroxytamoxifen (Sigma‑Aldrich, catalogue no. H7904) was added on day 5 at a concentration of 0.3 μg ml−1.
units.rationale: Activates the inducible eCas9 nuclease at a defined developmental stage.

units.title: Neural induction and Matrigel embedding
units.text: Neural induction was started on day 6. Embryoid bodies were embedded in Matrigel (Corning, catalogue no. 3524234) at day 11 or 12 based on morphology check.
units.rationale: Promotes neural lineage commitment and provides extracellular matrix support.

units.title: Adding CHIR99021 and switching to IDM‑A medium
units.text: CHIR99021 (Merck, catalogue no. 361571) at 3 μM was added from day 13 to day 16, and medium was switched to improved differentiation medium supplemented with B27 minus vitamin A (IDM‑A) at day 14.
units.rationale: Activates Wnt signaling and transitions cultures to a defined differentiation medium.

units.title: Switching to IDM+A medium and adding Matrigel later
units.text: On day 25, medium was switched to improved differentiation medium supplemented with B27 plus vitamin A (IDM+A); 1% Matrigel was added to the medium from day 40 to day 90.
units.rationale: Supports further neuronal maturation and structural stability of organoids.

units.title: Patterning ventralized organoids with SAG and IWP2
units.text: For ventralized organoids, we followed a previously published protocol47. Embryoid bodies were not embed‑ded, and patterning factors, including 100 nm SAG (Merck‑Millipore, catalogue no. ...) and 2.5 μM IWP2 (Sigma‑Aldrich, catalogue no. IO536), were added from day 5 to day 11.
units.rationale: Directs organoid fate toward ventral telencephalic identities.

units.title: Lentivirus production and low‑MOI infection of hES cells
units.text: Lentiviruses were packaged using HEK293T cells, and infection of hES cells was performed as before12. Infection rate was controlled to be lower than 5% to prevent multiple infections18.
units.rationale: Ensures single‑integration events for accurate clonal analysis.

units.title: Selecting and cloning top sgRNAs using VBC score and GeCKO protocol
units.text: The top four sgRNAs were first selected on the basis of predictions using multilayered Vienna Bioac‑tivity CRISPR (VBC) score54 and then subjected to the reporter assay to test editing efficiency. sgRNAs were cloned into the reporter assay lentivirus construct (containing the dual sgRNA cassette: U6‑sgRNA1‑H1‑sgRNA2) using the GeCKO cloning protocol55.
units.rationale: Identifies highly efficient sgRNAs and incorporates them into the dual‑sgRNA vector.
